key.name: full-size-cache-size
key.summary: Size of the full-size image cache in megabytes
key.description: The full-size cache is used to store full-size extracted video frames and downloaded album art.

key.name: thumbnail-cache-size
key.summary: Size of the thumbnail image cache in megabytes
key.description: The thumbnail image cache stores scaled thumbnail images.

key.name: failure-cache-size
key.summary: Size of the failure cache in megabytes
key.description: The failure cache records information about failed downloads or failed thumbnail extractions.

key.name: max-thumbnail-size
key.summary: Maximum size in pixels for a thumbnail
key.description: Requests for thumbnails larger than this will automatically reduce the thumbnail to max-thumbnail-size in the larger dimension. An exception are requests for local thumbnails with size 0x0, which are returned in their original size.

key.name: retry-not-found-hours
key.summary: Time to wait before re-trying for remote artwork that did not exist
key.description: If artwork cannot be retrieved because the remote server authoritavely confirmed that no artwork exists for an artist and album, this parameter defines how long the thumbnailer waits before trying to download the same image again. The default is 168 hours (one week).

key.name: retry-error-hours
key.summary: Time to wait before re-trying remote artwork that failed to download
key.description: If artwork cannot be retrieved from the remote server due to an unexpected error (such as the server not responding), this parameter defines how long the thumbnailer waits before trying to download the same image again. The default is two hours.

key.name: max-downloads
key.description: This parameter sets the maximum number of concurrent downloads for remote artwork.

key.name: max-extractions
key.summary: Maximum number of concurrent image extractions
key.description: This parameter sets the maximum number of concurrent image extractions from local media files. The default value is zero, which sets the value according to the number of CPU cores.
